purpose: Data points from screenshots to implement in On The Clock platform

screenshot_1.name: Team EPA Metrics - Offense vs Defense
screenshot_1.description: Team-level EPA per dropback and success rates for both offensive and defensive units
use_cases: Trade analysis (identify buy-low candidates on bad offenses with good EPA)

screenshot_2.name: Team Rushing EPA Metrics - Offense vs Defense
screenshot_2.description: Team-level rushing EPA per rush and success rates for both offensive and defensive units
insights: Best rushing offenses: BUF (0.091), WAS (0.089), DAL (0.052)
Worst rushing offenses: NE (-0.313), TB (-0.167), SEA (-0.154)
Best run defenses: TB (-0.318), LV (-0.277), DET (-0.228)
Worst run defenses: NO (0.160), TEN (0.118), BAL (0.108)
use_cases: RB value context (quality of offensive line and scheme)
Rushing matchup analysis (opponent run defense quality)
Game script predictions (teams that can run effectively control clock)
Dynasty RB evaluation (offensive environment matters more for RBs than any position)

screenshot_3.name: Team Explosive Play Rates - Offense vs Defense
screenshot_3.description: Team-level explosive play percentages (20+ yard passes, 15+ yard rushes) for both offensive and defensive units
insights: Best explosive pass offenses: SEA (7.2%), LAR (6.2%), BAL (5.3%), DEN (5.3%)
Best explosive run offenses: NYJ (11.7%), BAL (10.5%), DEN (8.0%)
Most explosive passes allowed: DAL (7.8%), NE (5.8%), TEN (5.1%), HOU (5.2%)
Most explosive runs allowed: NE (11.0%), CAR (9.7%), TEN (8.5%)
use_cases: Identify big-play WR/RB threats (high upside dynasty assets)
Matchup analysis for DFS and weekly starts (target defenses giving up explosives)
Ceiling projection adjustments (explosive offenses have higher weekly variance)
Deep threat WR evaluation (teams that generate explosive passes create WR1 weeks)
Game script prediction (explosive offenses can score quickly, affecting pace)

screenshot_4.name: Run Blocking & Rush Defense - Yards Before Contact
screenshot_4.description: Team-level offensive run blocking quality (yards before contact per attempt) and defensive rush defense quality (yards before contact allowed)
fields: OFF_YBCo_ATT (offensive yards before contact per rush attempt - run blocking quality)
DEF_YBCo_ATT (defensive yards before contact allowed per rush attempt - run defense quality)
insights: Best offensive run blocking: BAL (3.02), JAX (2.53), LAR (2.39), DEN (2.34)
Worst offensive run blocking: CIN (0.68), SF (1.02), NYG (1.07), PHI (1.14)
Worst rush defenses (most YBC allowed): NE (2.62), NO (2.26), TEN (2.19), LV (2.18)
Best rush defenses (least YBC allowed): MIN (0.51!), TB (0.80), BUF (1.10), NYJ (1.13)
use_cases: RB value context (offensive line quality is critical for RB success)
Dynasty RB evaluation (good O-line = sustainable production, bad O-line = regression risk)
RB matchup analysis (target RBs facing defenses that allow high YBC)
Trade analysis (RBs on bad O-lines with good individual stats = sell-high opportunities)
Rookie RB landing spot evaluation (O-line quality predicts rookie RB success more than draft capital)

implementation_notes: Will design and build features after all 10 screenshots are collected
